Certainly! A great mystery novel that fits your criteria is "The Ides of Sam" by Eric Van Lustbader. While the title might not exactly match your request for a protagonist named Sam, it's a compelling mystery involving a man who assumes a false identity.

However, if you're looking for a more precise match with a protagonist named Sam and a plot involving a fake identity, you might enjoy "The Fake" by Stuart M. Kaminsky. In this novel, the protagonist is Sam Spade, but it's a different take on the classic Sam Spade character from Dashiell Hammett's "The Maltese Falcon." The story follows Sam as he assumes various identities to uncover a dangerous conspiracy in 1940s New York City.

If you prefer a contemporary setting and a new protagonist named Sam, you might consider "The Identity Thief" by Michael P. Kube-McDowell. This novel features a protagonist named Sam who discovers he has been living someone else's life after his identity was stolen. He must navigate the legal system and uncover the truth about the person whose identity he now bears.

For a more modern and suspenseful take, "The Last Sam" by Jonathan Evison could be a good choice. Each of these novels offers a unique take on a protagonist using a fake identity within a mystery plot.
